title: EWY: Taking Stock Of The Largest South Korean ETF (NYSEARCA:EWY)
description: Discover key features, pros & cons of the iShares MSCI South Korea ETF, plus two alternative funds.
content:
The iShares MSCI South Korea ETF (NYSEARCA: EWY ), which is backed by Blackrock, and issued as part of their ‘iShares’ brand of ETFs. It is a +$5B-sized ETF, that is designed to provide exposure to around 80 stocks

Analyst’s Disclosure:I/we have no stock, option or similar derivative position in any of the companies mentioned, and no plans to initiate any such positions within the next 72 hours. I wrote this article myself, and it expresses my own opinions. I am not receiving compensation for it (other than from Seeking Alpha). I have no business relationship with any company whose stock is mentioned in this article.

Seeking Alpha's Disclosure: Past performance is no guarantee of future results. No recommendation or advice is being given as to whether any investment is suitable for a particular investor. summary: The iShares MSCI South Korea ETF (EWY) is backed by Blackrock and is part of their 'iShares' brand of ETFs. The EWY is designed to provide exposure to around 80 stocks. The article discusses the potential impact of this ETF on the market.
shortSummary: The iShares MSCI South Korea ETF (EWY) offers a significant amount of exposure to 80 stocks, with potential for future conflicts like that of Brexit and Russia.
argos_summary: The iShares MSCI South Korea ETF (EWY) is a $5 billion ETF that provides exposure to roughly 80 Korean stocks. The article outlines its key features, advantages and disadvantages, and compares it with two alternative funds. It includes standard disclosures from the author and Seeking Alpha, noting no investment recommendations or conflicts of interest.
